bru

Please add these back, I agree they were so cool to find and really made you feel lucky. I would love to see this re-added and so would many other people! Don't mess with it unless it's REALLY broken!

I agree. Spore blossoms should generate a lot more particles, but start emitting less if there are lots of them around and it's affecting performance--this way lag machines wouldn't be a big problem. Spore blossums and cave vines should generate more in lush caves, and cave vines should also generate with more glow berries on them.

maybe like they still float there, but once they are supposed to disappear then they "sink into the dirt/sand/gravel/etc"

I'm not quite sure how they'd do that but sounds awesome!

That's exactly how it would work, and if it rains the items sink in the ground faster. Also, what do you think should happen if items fell in the water? Should they disappear or be at the bottom I'm not sure. Just let me know.
hi
What do you mean by gravity? Like dirt blocks that fall on your head, and when you throw feathers on the ground, they fall slowly?

What do you mean by swapping? You could swap the textures, making it look like villagers are throwing mobs and you can trade with iron golems, or you could also make it so iron golems spawn in the villagers houses, while villagers spawn if there is enough iron golems.

I can only affirm your argument. There is no point in exploring the new beautiful caves when there are so little ores to find.
I think this is a good idea but only for the diamonds to increase below y=0,i do also think that it should be more dangerous below y=0 to balance

I think having ores spawn more frequently in the deeper caves is actually balanced when you consider the bottom of the world is going to be housing the Deep Dark cave biome with the Warden, a very powerful mob that reacts to vibrations!

Honestly, after playing around in the snapshot, the ore generation is fine, but there NEEDS to be coal generating a lot at ALL y-levels, or caving is impossible, because you can't make enough torches to light up the caves as you go.

Hi I have been playing Minecraft since 2014 and have tested the 1.17 update and .... where is the iron? I mined for 2 hours with my friends and we couldn't find enough iron to make full armor for all of them. Please Mojang correct it, we want to play minecraft because we love this game not out of nostalgia and not out of novelty, just to play, and we can't play without iron. Thank you very much for paying a little attention to my post. I love minecraft. And I will always love Minecraft.

if Mojang don't reverse these changes to ore generation by the time version 1.18 update comes around then I'm afraid I'm going to have to find an alternative sandbox game to play.

This game becoming more grindy is not what I asked for, nor you or anyone else who replied here, it's as you said going to make mining more tedious, and I might add less rewarding.

 

Having hostile mobs spawn at light level 9 instead of 7 or below, when players reach coordinate negative Y coordinates would be a far better way to introduce challenge, instead of making the game an endless grind, it shouldn't feel like a hamster in a wheel to get somewhere in the game progression system.

please make lunge and mending comatiable, otherwise, it would be really hard to repair a netherite spear, it would be too expensive, so please make lunge and mending compatiable.
It´s the only thing that i don´t like about the spear.
What are you talking about ?

The silly thing is you can already do this using an item modifier and function macros, but its a cumbersome, roundabout way to do something that should already be implemented. It doesn't need to update dynamically or anything, just resolve the components when the dialog is shown.

I only agree with the third suggestion . I can see it working the same way as placing a full block on a slab, where it fits into the nearest empty space above where you try to place. so you don't have to align the ghast.

i really want a speedier happy ghast.

according to my testing, nerd polling is as quick as the happy ghast and you can walk faster than it so scaffhold is still optimal
Yes
Yes, right idea for sprinting and placing blocks on Happy Ghast

The stark almost lifeless environment is out of place in the overworld and that's the idea, there's something wrong with this biome. But in my opinion this goes against the values of the overworld, a safe place, free of corruption and terror. Down and the caves it's a different story, lines between the safe haven of the overworld blur with more sinister concepts like the deep dark, imagine if you found that on the surface, it would look completely out of place. And that is the same issue the pale garden faces today. The developers have talked about Minecraft being a ecosystem, things need to be in balance and the pale garden disrupts that. 

From scientific point of view, (I know this is a video game) the leaves are grey, indicting a lack of chlorophyll which is used to harvest energy from the sun. Where would you expect to find a tree that is only used to harvesting low levels of light, down in a cave not on the surface. The warden makes perfect sense to put in a cave as it is creature that have evolved without light meaning that is relies on it's other senses. But the pale garden on the surface? Let's face it is a bit of an eyesore. I really like the line about the lush garden that failed. And if it's a cave biome it will also encourage players to actually go there for things other than building supplies. Like traveling through caverns or gathering ores. This will also encourage players to actually face the creaking especially if it spawns not matter what. It should be cave.

You can still have the biome be "wrong" for example instead of a corrupted dark oak biome just have a failed lush cave biome. It can still not fit into the ecosystem, but at least make it fit into the world. 

But one thing to considered, is that I mentioned before how it didn't fit into the ecosystem and it didn't fit into the world. That was probably the entire idea, let's make a biome that completely defies everything we have already established and make the player wonder "What is going on here?" In my opinion it's certainly a bold move and my theory is that they did consider making it a cave biome. I feel like the themes of this update "There's something wrong" feel like instead "This world is messed up" and maybe that's intended. It's a bold move for sure.

I LOVE the potato version, it's a comic relief. I would love to be able to keep it, rather than it disappearing or ceasing to function, as a lot of snapshots do. It's got awesome green blocks called potato stems along with the green door and traps that are made from it, that I wish were in the upcoming 1.21 update. We could use a green wood and the stone! I understand that the items from it couldn't be used in the regular Minecraft worlds, however, it has been loads of fun and I'd like to see it stay as a snapshot, at least. I laugh so hard over the Zombies growling 'potatoes'. I want to be able to visit it and play it, when I am bored in my regular Minecraft worlds. Please keep it!!!
I loved it you should make a mutant potato mob

Hallo Mojang
Bitte unbedingt das Potato Update so bringen, es hat grossartige Neuerungen dabei. Der Flotator ist absolut bahnbrechend und es wäre auch schön, ein so besonderes und abgefahrenes Biom (Dimension) zu bekommen. Weiter so, wir freuen uns darauf:-)
technically you can get diamond armor off mobs in skyblock
Same problem!
Bedrock parity.
It would be in Accessibility. Really could use a darkened version of the GUI.
Or there could be a built-in Dark mode resource pack.
I agree with this 100%. We should either have the option to switch the Creative GUI to the old one, or maybe have the option to customize the creative inventory to our liking. Would be pretty neat
you should removed chat moderation or give server owners the ability to opt out and moderate THEIR servers on their own.

Remove the chat reporting feature altogether, or make it opt in ONLY.

1. The system itself is far too exploitable on how things can be reported. The Gaslight exploit allows malicious users to outright delete messages sent, entirely changing the context of what was sent.

2. Server owners and staff should be responsible for moderating their own servers. They're the ones brunting the costs of maintaining the servers, and should be the ones to dictate how their server is run.

3. Other players shouldn't be responsible for PARENTING children who wander into offensive communities, AND NEITHER SHOULD MOJANG. PARENTS should be the ones monitoring their children's activity on Minecraft servers. If PARENTS don't want their children meeting unsavory people with the Minecraft chat function, either allow an option to disable it, or give a warning sign if parental controls are turned on if it's a new server.

For an actual suggestion to REPLACE chat reporting that coincides with the last point, add a "quick chat" function that can become the only method of communication for children via parental controls.

Think Toontown Online's "Speedchat" function, where a menu of chat categories drop down to give prewritten phrases. For Minecraft, some of these phrases could be "Hi there!" "I need {amount} {item}." "I'm stuck!" "My coordinates are {x} {y} {z} in the {dimension}." "HELP!"

Give us the ability to use Java 18 with 1.19.1/2 currently if you set Java 18 it says the runtime is incompatible, when there really is no reason for us to not be able to use newer Java versions with Minecraft if we explicitly set them to.
"We've analyzed claims about exploits that work in the final release of 1.19.1. You may have seen videos of exploit mods that claim to prove they work." -sun tzu

Optional censorship on servers should be added instead of CR. If someone typed in an inappropriate word in chat, the kids on that server would have already seen that, which means they might repeat that word on another server, even if they don’t know what it means, causing more kids to see that, and just causing a chain of bans. Having censorship will allow for the account that sent the message to do minimal harm, and having it be optional means servers can adjust that if wanted. The chat reporting system should still be in for offenses, though it should be up to the server admin to decide if a report should actually be sent to the mod team and reviewed.
Game isn't updating, there's no way to force it.

Reporting should be dealt with privately and on a per-server basis. I don't believe trying to fix exploits in a clearly shoddy system should be prioritised over fixing game features that players paid for. People did not pay for their private servers to be censored and dealt with by Mojang/Microsoft.

Ok, let me be very clear here, for the Minecraft community's sake, please do NOT continue with your chat moderation policies. They are far too exploitable, and do more damage than good. If you want the people in your community to be truly safe, or if you even care about us at all, then please, just remove the moderation. We really don't need it, since we literally handled our own servers better than your "highly trained moderation team." Microsoft as a company has ruined many games for it's community, please don't ruin Minecraft too. We can handle ourselves. We don't need YOUR help running OUR servers. Plus, you had previously stated that Java would "stay the same," and this is a major, and horrible change. If you truly want Minecraft to be a safe place, then get rid of your "moderation team," so we as players can stop being scared of being banned for the slightest things, because I don't think being afraid of losing your account is very "safe."
Minecraft 1.20 will save Minecraft but because of bugs and 1.19.1, Minecraft will shut down in July 7, 2023. #RIP MINECRAFT AND TECHNOBLADE

I'm not gonna what has already been said in these past few snapshots other than this.

Remove chat reporting or make it a purely optional, opt-in feature.

Listen to the community feedback that you are asking for, and put it to use.

this should have never been considered as in update it should have been scrap and never work on or even announce its sad that you are literally worse then EA at least they dont kill the games they have (am i gonna get banned in minecraft java cues i said kill in here twice ?????????????????)
Can't wait for Minecraft to die horribly in the next couple of updates with this chat moderation, 100% gonna see a huge drop in players and sales if it's possible to get perma-banned from servers.

Love this idea
First we have to make the potion of luck useful.
Nerf the warden
Fix the limited number of multinoise biome settings as it’s capped at one less then the number of preset biomes for the overworld
Reduce horn cool down it’s to long and not easy to hear

Great snapshot, finally the goat horn in Java! But, since four are tied to screaming goats, the percentage of screaming goats should be increased to 5% or 7% . Also, we NEED the birch forest changes. I like everything else in the snapshot though.
The goat horn appears to show up in every category in the creative menu. The delete item slot in the creative menu also shows a goat horn on it.

with the warden sonic attack changes if you spawn it you are almost guaranteed dead, please at least make it drop something more useful than a skulk catalyst (haven't had to playtest but the changelog sounds like that might be the case).
Uncrafted boatchest, minecart chest, etc...

I like the Warden changes. Wardens dropping sculk catalyst is great for renewability and tech players. I'm hoping there's more renewable options, like cave spiders dropping cobweb (which gives mineshafts a unique reason to explore), or husks dropping sand! Now that the sonic attack deals less damage, the animation and cooldown needs to be faster so that the Warden can kill distracting mobs faster. Wardens should try to move a bit faster on liquids!

Getting goat horns should be easier, right now it seems too difficult to make a goat ram something. Screaming goat spawn chance can be increased a bit.

Still hoping for fireflies and birch forest changes. Ambience like fireflies and sound effects in the wild (like crickets, sea winds, rustling leaves, cave drips etc) is something that a lot of players wanted. Those new decorative blocks and changes to the birch forest is really good!

I'm generally against the "nature friendly" excuse, that fireflies are poisonous to frogs (but magma cubes aren't). Just rename them to glowbugs, or just let them coexist without frogs eating them? I really wanted fireflies in bottles as light sources. Minecraft shouldn't be a PETA moral compass to teach kids that $h@rrks and @l1igators aren't bad, it's a survival game where you do what you need to do to survive. If you must use fantasy creatures, add creatures similar to them. Avoid adding too many humanoid and undead enemies; we can instead make bane of arthropods enchant useful.

Thank you for the snapshot! :)

I'm glad goat horns are back, but they could still use some tweaks imo. If we could play sound effects from the game itself using them, that'd make for a very interesting and fun item to use.

While everyone is talking about the Warden changes, I'm going to talk about the new security features in this snapshot. The secure chat signing is great. It'll prevent spambots and DDoS attacks which is great. Kinda disappointed that it's defaulted to false but it'll change. From what I've read I assume that you cannot join servers without a keypair meaning yeah, spambots and DDoS attacks are prevented, the bot types anyway. More security the better, and this security change doesn't impact gameplay at all. Since you get the keypair at startup. Thanks Mojang.

Im on an ASUS Laptop on 22w17a. And my skin shows up as a steve instead of what it really is.  Can you try to find a way to fix it? And ive got an idea for the next snapshot. Please, add fireflies. I would also love to see poison dart frogs in jungles. Regular swamps have witch huts. What about mangrove swamps? Also, good job on the music disc "5". I would like to see a music disc that is white on the outside, like quartz. And diamond on the inside. The song choice is yours. I saw the amethyst "Litblockstate". Could you consider adding it? Id love it. Can you make magma blocks set you on fire when you step on them? It would just make sense to me. Thats all i have.

Please make warden sonic boom bypass protection enchantment. Warden was hugely nerfed with sonic attack only dealing a very small amount of damage to prot4 netherite armor. Sure it's more frequent, but a little over a heart of damage per 2 seconds is so easy to counter I can basically ignore the stealth aspect. Being a veteran player, I was so excited to be able to have something to fear, as we were told it would "make veteran players fear like it's their first night". This change nerfs the warden so badly he's went from very exciting, to very disappointing after over a year of hype.
make the warden not despawn in peaceful mode
Great snapshot, here's a suggestion : goat horn sounds should play when dispensed by a dispenser, allowing players to automatically trigger this sound without the help of command blocks

The Warden's attacks should bypass the Protection enchantment. With the old damage it could deliver a scare even with prot IV.

In addition to that, the deep dark biomes need 1-2 final touch-ups. that being small bone structures or increased fossil frequency, and an ore change to match the content it was supposed to ship out with originally.
I think that there should spawn a map to the ancient cities in the pillager outpost and woodland mancions, because it's to difficult to find them and it looks like pillagers were there.

Warden should deal at least 16 health points with a ranged attack and should avoid protection. Also, sculk shriekers should block elytra flying when summoned warden:
easy: 5 seconds
normal: 10 second
hard: 20 seconds
The Warden should also be resistant to projectiles such as arrows.

Warden is weak.
With only two blocks stacked, Warden's melee attacks are less challenging. If you have enchantments on your armor, weapons, etc., you can easily take them down and not have the fear of being killed! I think it would be better to go back to the previous specification of 4 blocks to be attacked at close range.

The allays seem much improved, but I still think they need some polishing. Right now the biggest issue for me is that they wander so far away from the player! I would like to use the allays around my base to sort items, but I'd also like to go on adventures with them when collecting lots of resources like cobblestone or sand to gather up any I've missed. Right now they work well for bases, but not for adventuring. Allays should follow a player more closely when out on gathering missions. 

To fix this, maybe when the allay has an item it can know when there's a playing noteblock and have a big wandering radius, but if there isn't a noteblock around it will know it's meant to follow a player more closely and only wander a short distance away? I think it should also know when a player is moving and quickly fly to catch up, instead of a player easily being able to sprint away out of its sight.
dont force online mode for single player if you dont have internet it locks you out of the game due to the chat changes

I don't want in-game chat handled by Microsoft! Let servers handle it. It was good as it was.

-10,000,000

Other features are good.

Warden's sonic boom should be dampened by wool. Each layer wool decreases damage taken by the player. Also, Warden's sonic boom should only be used as a last resort if it can't get to you. It should not use the attack if you are running away from it. Sonic boom damage is perfect as is and should not be increased. Also, the sonic boom should not bypass protection enchantment.

why minecraft dont use half renderer? so the new 1.18 cave and cliffs part 2 aka lag update will do a singnificant downfall of player count cus of the lag so here are tips 1st use half renderer where only 30 blocks beneath the player will be loaded which will reduce the lag 2nd wworld scaling allowing us how much world we wanna load uppon genrating one 3rd lazy chunk loading where player can choose how fast they wanna load the chunk keep very fast fast normal slow very slow so we can choose very slow which will help to reduce lag A LOTTTTTT cus it will be smoother for cpu gpu! here are some tips + add a option to remove fog its annoying and in 1.18 it causing us to see less :/
Just change the ore distribution. We don't need copper shears and armor and a ton of other useless items.
I like copper shears, but not armor or tools. I also would like to see copper buckets (for water only, though).
I like the idea of having shears being craftable with copper as well, but I'd rather there not be another set of armor :T
CHANGE THE TEXTURE OF COPPER; GOLD AND IRON BACK TO THE OLD DESIGN (21w13a

the ore works with fortune, so you could get 4 iron/gold/copper from 1 ore, isn't that great?

or I think its too OP

The raw ore items were implemented for a few reasons.

A: People were complaining that copper was too hard to build with even after they changed the crafting recipe. Using fortune on copper ore fixed this problem.

B: Hopper Chains are increasingly difficult to make on Bedrock Edition due to iron farms being broken on the version. Fortuning Iron ore fixed this problem.

C: It gave more uses to BOTH silk touch and fortune. Silk touch can now be used to get metal ores, and Fortune can now be used on overworld gold, iron, and copper ores. 

D: It made all ores the same while also keeping the aspect of having to smelt metal ores. Now, fortune and silk touch can be used the same across all ore blocks besides nether gold and ancient debris.

E: You have to admit the Raw Iron texture is great, it looks like a boot :D

You have a point, but the fact is that ore items are not as useful as they said they were. Nobody ever uses ore blocks for building except in underground/cave builds, so the fact that ore blocks are able to be placed is irrelevant. Also, why should it be easy to place metal ores, but not gemstone ones? Raw Ore items also do NOT need uses like amethyst does, as their only usage is to get the refined ingot. This would be like saying that pre-1.17 ores need more crafting recipes.

The 21w14a snapshot was random, unexpected, and yet still delivered a great feature to the game. I hope to see more snapshots like it.
The point of raw ores is that you can now use the Fortune enchantment on all ores, so it does have a purpose and should not be removed. Also, I do agree that the raw copper texture needs some work.

I love the new raw ores!

It saves inventory space because im not lugging around a deepslate and stone variant of iron and gold ore blocks.
You guys bring up some valid points, but what do you guys think about the textures?

Raw ore makes resource extraction too easy due to the "Fortune" enchantment. Very easy. The amount of resources received is almost doubled. Reducing inventory clogging is not necessary, since bundles already exist for this purpose.

I'm also not a big fan of the addition of raw ores, but I can see why they made that change. If you were to mine iron ore then deepslate iron ore, they would take up separate inventory slots, whereas both regular and deepslate drop raw iron, saving inventory space. Maybe the option to toggle between mining regular ore blocks and mining raw ore could be added instead of raw ore being entirely removed?
I think one of the main reasons it was added is the fact that we now have 2 diffrent types of every ore so it A saves space in your inventory while mining and B saves smelting space
Its so that the mined deepslate ores and normal ores stack, also this can be undone by changing the blockdrops of ores using a datapack
I like the new copper and gold textures, but my iron boot is gone :(

raw ores were added so you don't need 2 types of copper/iron/gold ores in your inventory to prevent inventory clunking I think it is good idea because having 1 slot  type rather than 2 slots used its a really good feature in my opinion :D
like a piece of bark?

I find it annoying and stressful that the honeycombs disappear when they are scraped and end up just never waxing anything in fear that I will scrape them on accident or when I can’t decide on which state I want to wax the item.
Getting bark actually sounds like it could be a good idea.
It's because of the new cave generation. I am sure it will be worked on since this isn't the official generation.
